description: Todoist offers more useful features than any other to do service. So you can do more to customize the experience, organize your tasks and projects, and optimize your productivity.

events.name: webhookEvent
events.description: The Todoist Webhooks API allows applications to receive real-time notification (in the form of HTTP POST payload) on the subscribed user events. Notice that once you have a webhook setup, you will start receiving webhook events from all your app users immediately.
steps: Before you can start receiving webhook event notifications, you must first have your webhook configured at the Todoist App Management Console.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchanging authorization codes for access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The unique Client ID of the Todoist application that you registered.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The unique Client Secret of the Todoist application that you registered.

args.name: code
args.info: The unique string code that you obtained in the authorization request.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The URL to which to send the response to this request.

blocks.name: revokeAccessToken
blocks.description: Access tokens obtained via OAuth could be revoke.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The unique Client ID of the Todoist application that you registered.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The unique Client Secret of the Todoist application that you registered.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

blocks.name: exchangeApiToken
blocks.description: Tokens obtained via the old email/password authentication method could be migrated to the new OAuth access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The unique Client ID of the Todoist application that you registered.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The unique Client Secret of the Todoist application that you registered.

args.name: apiToken
args.info: Token obtained from the email/password authentication.

args.name: scope

structure.name: scope
structure.info: Single scope name.

args.info: Scopes of the OAuth token. Please refer to the OAuth section for the detailed list of available scopes.

blocks.name: crossOriginResourceSharing
blocks.description: All API endpoints not related to the 3 OAuth steps support Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) for requests from any origin.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication

args.name: origin
args.info: Cross Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)

blocks.name: readResources
blocks.description: Tokens obtained via the old email/password authentication method could be migrated to the new OAuth access token.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: syncToken
args.info: A special string, used to allow the client to perform incremental sync. Pass * to retrieve all active resource data.

args.name: resourceTypes

structure.name: resourceTypes
structure.info: Single resource type.

args.info: Used to specify what resources to fetch from the server.

blocks.name: createProject
blocks.description: Create project.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: tempId
structure.info: The temporary resource ID feature allows you to run two or more dependent commands in a single HTTP request.See more in readme.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: name
structure.info: The name of the project (a string value).

structure.name: color
structure.info: The color of the project (a number between 0 and 11, or between 0 and 21 for premium users).

structure.name: indent
structure.info: The indent of the item (a number between 1 and 4, where 1 is top-level).

structure.name: itemOrder
structure.info: Project’s order in the project list (a number, where the smallest value should place the project at the top).

args.name: accessToken

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The id of the project (could be temp id).

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: name
structure.info: The name of the project (a string value).

structure.name: color
structure.info: The color of the project (a number between 0 and 11, or between 0 and 21 for premium users).

structure.name: indent
structure.info: The indent of the item (a number between 1 and 4, where 1 is top-level).

structure.name: itemOrder
structure.info: Projectâ€™s order in the project list (a number, where the smallest value should place the project at the top).

structure.name: collapsed
structure.info: Whether the project’s sub-projects are collapsed (where 1 is true and 0 is false).

blocks.name: updateMultipleOrdersAndIndents
blocks.description: Update the orders and indents of multiple projects at once.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: uuid
args.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

args.name: idsToOrdersIndents
args.info: A dictionary array, with a project id as key and a two elements list as value: project_id: [item_order, indent]

structure.name: projectId
structure.info: The id of the project (could be temp id).

structure.name: itemOrder
structure.info: Project’s order in the project list (a number, where the smallest value should place the project at the top).

structure.name: indent
structure.info: The indent of the item (a number between 1 and 4, where 1 is top-level).

blocks.name: createItem
blocks.description: Add a new task to a project.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: tempId
structure.info: The temporary resource ID feature allows you to run two or more dependent commands in a single HTTP request.See more in readme.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: content
structure.info: The text of the task.

structure.name: projectId
structure.info: The id of the project to add the task to (a number or a temp id). By default the task is added to the user’s Inbox project.

structure.name: dateString
structure.info: The date of the task, added in free form text, for example it can be every day @ 10 (or null or an empty string to unset).

structure.name: dateLang
structure.info: The language of the dateString.

structure.name: dueDateUtc
structure.info: Note that, when the dueDateUtc argument is specified, the date_string is required and has to specified as well, and also, the date_string argument will be parsed as local timestamp, and converted to UTC internally, according to the user’s profile settings.

structure.name: priority
structure.info: The priority of the task (a number between 1 and 4, 4 for very urgent and 1 for natural).

structure.name: indent
structure.info: The indent of the task (a number between 1 and 4, where 1 is top-level).

structure.name: itemOrder
structure.info: The order of the task inside a project (a number, where the smallest value would place the task at the top).

structure.name: dayOrder
structure.info: The order of the task inside the Today or Next 7 days view (a number, where the smallest value would place the task at the top).

structure.name: collapsed
structure.info: Whether the task’s sub-tasks are collapsed (where 1 is true and 0 is false).

structure.name: labels
structure.info: The tasks labels (a list of label ids such as [2324,2525]).

structure.name: assignedByUid
structure.info: The id of user who assigns the current task. This makes sense for shared projects only.

structure.name: responsibleUid
structure.info: The id of user who is responsible for accomplishing the current task. This makes sense for shared projects only.

structure.name: autoReminder
structure.info: When this option is enabled, the default reminder will be added to the new item if it has a due date with time set.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The id of the task.

structure.info: The text of the task.

structure.info: The id of the project to add the task to (a number or a temp id). By default the task is added to the user’s Inbox project.

structure.name: dateString
structure.info: The date of the task, added in free form text, for example it can be every day @ 10 (or null or an empty string to unset).

structure.name: dateLang
structure.info: The language of the dateString.

structure.name: dueDateUtc
structure.info: Note that, when the dueDateUtc argument is specified, the date_string is required and has to specified as well, and also, the date_string argument will be parsed as local timestamp, and converted to UTC internally, according to the user’s profile settings.

structure.name: priority
structure.info: The priority of the task (a number between 1 and 4, 4 for very urgent and 1 for natural).

structure.name: indent
structure.info: The indent of the task (a number between 1 and 4, where 1 is top-level).

structure.name: itemOrder
structure.info: The order of the task inside a project (a number, where the smallest value would place the task at the top).

structure.name: dayOrder
structure.info: The order of the task inside the Today or Next 7 days view (a number, where the smallest value would place the task at the top).

structure.name: collapsed
structure.info: Whether the task’s sub-tasks are collapsed (where 1 is true and 0 is false).

structure.name: labels
structure.info: The tasks labels (a list of label ids such as [2324,2525]).

structure.name: assignedByUid
structure.info: The id of user who assigns the current task. This makes sense for shared projects only.

structure.name: responsibleUid

blocks.name: deleteItem
blocks.description: Delete an existing task.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: uuid
args.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

args.name: itemIds

structure.name: singleProjectId
structure.info: Single project id.

args.info: List of the ids of the projects to delete (could be temp ids).

blocks.name: moveItem
blocks.description: Move a task from one project to another project.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: projectItems
structure.info: A JSON mapping telling Todoist where the items are currently found. From project ids to item ids, for example {`1523`:[`9637423`]}, where 1523 is the project id and 9637423 is the item id.

structure.name: toProject
structure.info: The project id that the tasks should be moved to, for example 1245.

blocks.name: completeItems
blocks.description: Complete tasks and optionally move them to history. See also itemClose for a simplified version of the command.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: uuid
args.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

args.name: itemIds

structure.name: singleItemId
structure.info: Single item id (complete).

args.info: A list of ids to complete (numbers or temp ids).

args.name: forceHistory
args.info: Whether these tasks should be moved to history (where 1 is true and 0 is false, and the default is 1) This is useful when checking off sub tasks.

blocks.name: uncompleteItems
blocks.description: Uncomplete tasks and move them to the active projects.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: uuid
args.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

args.name: itemIds

structure.name: singleItemId
structure.info: Single item id (complete).

args.info: A list of items to uncomplete.

args.name: restoreState
args.info: A dictionary object, where the item id is the key, and its value is a list of four elements, whether the item is in history, whether it is checked, its order and indent - item_id: [in_history, checked, item_order, indent].

blocks.name: completeRecurringTask
blocks.description: Complete a recurring task, and the reason why this is a special case is because we need to mark a recurring completion (and using itemUpdate won’t do this). See also item_close for a simplified version of the command.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: newDateUtc
structure.info: Note that, when the new_date_utc argument is specified, the date_string is required and has to specified as well, and also, the date_string argument will be parsed as local timestamp, and converted to UTC internally, according to the user’s profile settings.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The id of the item to update (a number or a temp id).

structure.name: dateString
structure.info: The date of the task, added in free form text, for example it can be every day @ 10 (or null or an empty string to unset).

structure.name: isForward
structure.info: Whether the task is to be completed (value 1) or uncompleted (value 0), while the default is 1.

blocks.name: closeItem
blocks.description: A simplified version of itemComplete . The command does exactly what official clients do when you close a task: regular task is completed and moved to history, subtask is checked (marked as done, but not moved to history), recurring task is moved forward (due date is updated).

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The id of the item to close (a number or a temp id).

blocks.name: createReminder
blocks.description: Add a new reminder to the user account related to the API credentials.Is only available for Todoist Premium.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: tempId
structure.info: The temporary resource ID feature allows you to run two or more dependent commands in a single HTTP request.See more in readme.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: itemId
structure.info: The item id for which the reminder is about.

structure.name: notifyUid
structure.info: The user id which should be notified of the reminder, typically the current user id creating the reminder.

structure.name: service
structure.info: The way to get notified of the reminder: email for e-mail, mobile for mobile text message, or push for mobile push notification.

structure.name: type
structure.info: The type of the reminder: relative for a time-based reminder specified in minutes from now, absolute for a time-based reminder with a specific time and date in the future, and location for a location-based reminder.

structure.name: dateString
structure.info: The date of the reminder, added in free form text, for example it can be every day @ 10 (or null or an empty string to unset).

structure.name: dateLang
structure.info: The language of the dateString.

structure.name: dueDateUtc
structure.info: Note that, when the due_date_utc argument is specified, the date_string is required and has to specified as well, and also, the date_string argument will be parsed as local timestamp, and converted to UTC internally, according to the user’s profile settings.

structure.name: minuteOffset
structure.info: The relative time in minutes before the due date of the item, in which the reminder should be triggered. Note, that the item should have a due date set in order to add a relative reminder.

structure.name: name
structure.info: An alias name for the location.

structure.name: coordinates
structure.info: Location coordinates.

structure.name: locTrigger
structure.info: What should trigger the reminder: on_enter for entering the location, or on_leave for leaving the location.

structure.name: radius
structure.info: The radius around the location that is still considered as part of the location (in meters).

blocks.name: updateReminder
blocks.description: Update a reminder from the user account related to the API credentials.Is only available for Todoist Premium.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The id of the reminder.

structure.name: notifyUid
structure.info: The user id which should be notified of the reminder, typically the current user id creating the reminder.

structure.name: service
structure.info: The way to get notified of the reminder: email for e-mail, mobile for mobile text message, or push for mobile push notification.

structure.name: type
structure.info: The type of the reminder: relative for a time-based reminder specified in minutes from now, absolute for a time-based reminder with a specific time and date in the future, and location for a location-based reminder.

structure.name: dateString
structure.info: The date of the reminder, added in free form text, for example it can be every day @ 10 (or null or an empty string to unset).

structure.name: dateLang
structure.info: The language of the dateString.

structure.name: dueDateUtc
structure.info: Note that, when the due_date_utc argument is specified, the date_string is required and has to specified as well, and also, the date_string argument will be parsed as local timestamp, and converted to UTC internally, according to the user’s profile settings.

structure.name: minuteOffset
structure.info: The relative time in minutes before the due date of the item, in which the reminder should be triggered. Note, that the item should have a due date set in order to add a relative reminder.

structure.name: name
structure.info: An alias name for the location.

structure.name: coordinates
structure.info: Location coordinates.

structure.name: locTrigger
structure.info: What should trigger the reminder: on_enter for entering the location, or on_leave for leaving the location.

structure.name: radius
structure.info: The radius around the location that is still considered as part of the location (in meters).

blocks.description: Delete a reminder from the user account related to the API credentials.Is only available for Todoist Premium.

blocks.name: getAllCompletedItems
blocks.description: Only available for Todoist Premium users.Get all the user’s completed items (tasks).Is only available for Todoist Premium.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: projectId
args.info: Filter the tasks by project id.

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of items to return (where the default is 30, and the maximum is 50).

args.name: offset
args.info: Can be used for pagination, when more than the limit number of tasks are returned.

args.name: until
args.info: Return items with a completed date same or older than until (a string value formatted as 2007-4-29T10:13).

args.name: since
args.info: Return items with a completed date newer than since (a string value formatted as 2007-4-29T10:13).

args.name: annotateNotes
args.info: Return notes together with the completed items (a true or false value).

blocks.name: getArchivedProjects

args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: itemId

args.name: allData
args.info: Whether to return the parent project and notes of the item (a true or false value, while the default is true).

blocks.name: quickAddTask
blocks.description: Add a new task using the Quick Add Task implementation available in the official clients.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: text
args.info: The text of the task that is parsed. It can include a due date in free form text, a project name starting with the # character, a label starting with the @ character, and an assignee starting with the + character.

args.name: note
args.info: The content of the note.

args.name: reminder
args.info: The date of the reminder, added in free form text.

blocks.name: registerNewUser
blocks.description: Register a new user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: email
args.info: The user’s email.

args.name: fullName
args.info: The user’s real name formatted as Firstname Lastname.

args.name: password
args.info: The user’s password.

args.name: lang
args.info: The user’s language.

args.name: timezone
args.info: The user’s timezone (a string value such as UTC, Europe/Lisbon, US/Eastern, Asian/Taipei). By default we use the user’s IP address to determine the timezone.

blocks.name: updateUsersProperties
blocks.description: Update user’s properties

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: commands
args.info: Array of Command object. Each command will be processed in the specified order.

structure.name: tempId
structure.info: The temporary resource ID feature allows you to run two or more dependent commands in a single HTTP request.See more in readme.

structure.name: uuid
structure.info: You should generate a unique string ID for each command and specify it in the uuid field.See more in readme.

structure.name: email
structure.info: The user’s email.

structure.name: fullName
structure.info: The user’s real name formatted as Firstname Lastname.

structure.name: password
structure.info: The user’s password.

structure.name: timezone
structure.info: The user’s timezone (a string value such as UTC, Europe/Lisbon, US/Eastern, Asian/Taipei). By default we use the user’s IP address to determine the timezone.

structure.name: startPage
structure.info: The user’s default view on Todoist. The start page can be one of the following: _info_page for the info page, _blank for a blank page, _project_<PROJECT_ID> for project with id <PROJECT_ID>, and <ANY_QUERY> to query after anything.

structure.name: startDay
structure.info: The first day of the week (between 1 and 7, where 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday).

structure.name: nextWeek
structure.info: The day of the next week, that tasks will be postponed to (between 1 and 7, where 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday).

structure.name: timeFormat
structure.info: Whether to use a 24h format such as 13:00 (if set to 0) when displaying time, or a 12h format such as 1:00pm (if set to 1).

structure.name: timeFormat
structure.info: Whether to use a 24h format such as 13:00 (if set to 0) when displaying time, or a 12h format such as 1:00pm (if set to 1).

structure.name: dateFormat
structure.info: Whether to use the DD-MM-YYYY date format (if set to 0), or the MM-DD-YYYY format (if set to 1).

structure.name: sortOrder
structure.info: Whether to show projects in an oldest dates first order (if set to 0, or a oldest dates last order (if set to 1).

structure.name: defaultReminder
structure.info: The default reminder for the user.

structure.name: autoReminder
structure.info: The default time in minutes for the automatic reminders set, whenever a due date has been specified for a task.

structure.name: mobileNumber
structure.info: The default time in minutes for the automatic reminders set, whenever a due date has been specified for a task.

structure.name: mobileHost
structure.info: The user’s mobile host (or null if not set).

structure.name: theme
structure.info: The currently selected Todoist theme (between 0 and 10).

structure.name: uuid

structure.name: dailyGoal
structure.info: The target number of tasks to complete per day.

structure.name: weeklyGoal
structure.info: The target number of tasks to complete per week.

structure.name: ignoreDays
structure.info: list with the days of the week to ignore (1 for Monday and 7 for Sunday).

structure.name: vacationMode
structure.info: Marks the user as being on vacation (where 1 is true and 0 is false).

structure.name: karmaDisabled
structure.info: Whether to disable the karma and goals measuring altogether (where 1 is true and 0 is false).

blocks.name: rejectBusinessInvitation
blocks.description: The invitation is rejected and deleted. Note that the client doesn’t have to provide the user’s token to reject invitation: it’s enough to provide knowledge of invitation secret business account yet.Only available for Todoist Premium users.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: invitationId
args.info: The invitation id (a number).

args.name: secret
args.info: The secret fetched from the live notification (a string value).

blocks.name: getActivityLogs
blocks.description: Get activity logs.Is only available for Todoist Premium.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: Access token obtained from the OAuth authentication.

args.name: objectType
args.info: Filters events by a specific object type.

args.name: objectId
args.info: Filters events by a specific object id, but only if the objectType has been also specified.

args.name: eventType
args.info: Filters events by a specific event type.

args.name: objectEventTypes
args.info: An alternative way to filter by multiple object and event types. This takes a list of strings of the form [object_type]:[event_type] (where either object_type part or the event_type part can be omitted), such as for example [`item:`, `note:added`]. When this parameter is specified the object_type, event_type and object_id parameters are ignored.

args.name: parentProjectId
args.info: Filters object events by the id of the project they belong to, so this implicitly limits the results to items and notes.

args.name: parentItemId
args.info: Filters object events by the id of the project they belong to, so this implicitly limits the results to items and notes.

args.name: initiatorId
args.info: Filters event by the id of the initiator.

args.name: since
args.info: Return items with a completed date newer than since (a string value formatted as 2007-4-29T10:13).

args.name: until
args.info: Return items with a completed date same or older than until (a string value formatted as 2007-4-29T10:13).

args.name: limit
args.info: The number of events to return, where the default is 30, and the maximum is 100.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of events to skip, which can be used for pagination in order to get more events than those returned by the previous call.
